concise_definition: n. 磁带, 录音带, 胶带, 带状物

definitions.explanation_en: A long, thin strip of material, typically made of plastic or fabric, used for binding, sealing, or holding things together, often with an adhesive surface.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指由塑料或织物制成的长条状材料，通常带有粘性表面，用于捆绑、密封或固定物品。
definitions.example_en: She used duct tape to repair the broken chair leg.
definitions.example_cn: 她用胶带修补了断裂的椅子腿。

definitions.explanation_en: A thin, flexible strip of magnetic material used for recording and playing back sound or video, commonly used before digital storage became widespread.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指用于录制和播放声音或视频的薄型磁性材料带，曾在数字存储普及前广泛使用。
definitions.example_en: He found an old cassette tape of his favorite band from the 1980s.
definitions.example_cn: 他找到了一张80年代最爱乐队的旧磁带。

definitions.explanation_en: A recording made on magnetic tape, especially audio or video content preserved for later playback.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在磁带上录制的内容，尤其是为日后播放而保存的音频或视频资料。
definitions.example_en: The police reviewed the surveillance tapes to identify the suspect.
definitions.example_cn: 警方审查了监控录像以识别嫌疑人。

definitions.explanation_en: A strip of material used in sports or medical contexts to support muscles or joints, often made of elastic fabric.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在体育或医疗环境中用于支撑肌肉或关节的弹性织物带，如运动贴布。
definitions.example_en: The athlete wore kinesiology tapes on his knee to reduce pain during the game.
definitions.example_cn: 运动员在膝盖上贴了肌效贴布，以减轻比赛时的疼痛。

comparison.analysis: “Film”（胶片）通常指用于摄影或电影的感光材料，强调光学成像功能，而 “tape” 更侧重于磁性记录或物理粘附功能。虽然两者都可用于记录影像，但 “film” 是模拟光学介质，而 “tape” 是磁性电子介质。
“Ribbon”（丝带）多指装饰性、非粘性的窄条织物，常用于礼品包装或仪式场合，强调美观而非功能性。而 “tape” 通常具有实用目的，如粘合、固定或记录，功能性强于装饰性。
“Recording”（录音）是抽象名词，泛指任何被记录下来的声音或影像内容，而 “tape” 是承载该内容的物理媒介。可以说 “a recording on tape”，但不能说 “a tape is a recording” —— tape 是载体，recording 是内容。
